Plants have been conceded as enriched reservoir of pharmaceutically vital products due to wide spectrum of health attributes . Employing latest technological approaches, the focus of pharmaceutical industries is diverting towards specific compounds having respective metabolic role
1 . Fagonia indica (L.) is a remarkable pharmaceutical specie, belongs to the genus “ Fagonia” and commonly known as “sacchi booti”
2 . This genus was named after Guy-Crescent Fagon, botanist and first physician to the French King Louis XIV (1638–1718). The species included in the genus Fagonia other than Fagonia indica are Fagonia cretica, Fagonia olivieri and Fagonia Arabica
3 . Fagonia indica is restricted to warm and arid zones of the world and can be found mostly in arid and semi-arid areas of Pakistan, India and other Asian areas globally
